intro: Halocharis lachnantha var. macrantha, commonly known as the showy halocharis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features hairy, glandular leaves that are typically gray-green in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy ornamental plant. Its compact growth habit and vibrant floral display make it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
